title: Understanding Scatter Plots
text: A scatter plot is a graphical representation that shows the relationship between two sets of data. Each point on the graph corresponds to a pair of values from the sets. Let's look at the data points you have and understand their meaning.

title: Identifying Data Points
text: Review the list of data points: $$(1,46)$$, $$(2,50)$$, $$(3,59)$$, $$(4,75)$$, $$(5,100)$$, and $$(6,136)$$. Start by plotting these points on a graph. Each pair of numbers represents a coordinate (x,y).

title: Observing the Trend
text: Look at how the points are positioned relative to each other. Do they form a specific pattern or trend? In this case, it seems like the values increase quite a bit as $$x$$ values increase.

title: Comparing Graphs
text: Now, compare the graph you visualized with the provided Graph A, B, and C. Which graph has points that match the trend and position of your data points?

title: Choosing the Correct Graph
text: Evaluate each graph to see where each data point fits the best. This will guide you to the correct graph.
